Model.Playground

Interface IEnemyPlayground

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPlayground
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EnemyPlayground

    public interface IEnemyPlayground
extends IPlayground

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setAllLabelsNonClickable()
      Sets all labels of the enemy playground non clickable Use this method, after the player clicked on an Label, so that he cant accidentally try to shoot 2 times at once
      void setAllWaterFieldsClickable()
      Sets the disabled status to all labels of the fields which should be able to get clicked (which are only water) on true
      ShotResponse shoot(Point pos_shot, int answer)
      Call this method on the enemy playground when you shot the enemy and you know, what you hit Draws the shot-position in the playground depending on the answer parameter Also marks all impossible positions as ShotWater, when a ship is sunken If the ship is sunken, the ShotResponse contains following information: 1.

      • Methods inherited from interface Model.Playground.IPlayground

        buildPlayground, drawPlayground, resetAll, setLabels

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        ShotResponse shoot(Point pos_shot,
                   int answer)
        Call this method on the enemy playground when you shot the enemy and you know, what you hit Draws the shot-position in the playground depending on the answer parameter Also marks all impossible positions as ShotWater, when a ship is sunken If the ship is sunken, the ShotResponse contains following information: 1. The information if the game is won 2. An Point-Array of impossible positions 3. The label of the topLeft position, where the sunken ship was placed 4. The information if the ship was placed horizontal or vertical 5. The size of the Ship In any other case the return value can be ignored
        Parameters:
        pos_shot - The position where the player is shooting the enemy playground
        answer - The answer from the connection partner 0: shipHit false, shipSunken false 1: shipHit true, shipSunken false 2: shipHit true, shipSunken true
        Returns:
        An object of type ShotResponse, the object contains all necessary information

      • setAllLabelsNonClickable

        void setAllLabelsNonClickable()
        Sets all labels of the enemy playground non clickable Use this method, after the player clicked on an Label, so that he cant accidentally try to shoot 2 times at once

      • setAllWaterFieldsClickable

        void setAllWaterFieldsClickable()
        Sets the disabled status to all labels of the fields which should be able to get clicked (which are only water) on true
